explanation: The cause is that the QIcon() function is not defined in Python 3.
The cause is that the scaling of the pixmap is not done correctly.
The cause is that the QAction class has a method called triggered.
The cause is that the user_hostmask is not a string, but a tuple.
The if statement can be replaced with 'var = bool(test)'
The cause is that the "self.setBold.stateChanged" is not connected to the "self.checkBold".
The cause is that the super() function is called in the __init__() function.
The cause is that the QCheckBox is not a widget.
The cause is that the checkbox is not checked.
The cause is that the stateChanged signal is not connected to the changedSetting method.
